stimulusHtml: During which process is the amount of work done on the gas equal to the amount of energy that the gas exchanges with its surroundings through heating or cooling?

features.html: A closed chamber filled with a gas that is modeled as ideal has a movable piston of area A. The graph above of pressure P as a function of volume V shows three processes that make up cycle XYZX through which the gas is taken. Process ZX is isothermal.

choicesHtml: None of the processes; the amount of work done on the gas is always greater than the amount of energy that the gas exchanges with its surroundings through heating or cooling.
